sources.title: Donovan's Reef (1963) John Wayne · Lee Marvin
sources.description: The John Ford / John Wayne team created a South Seas comedy with " Donovan's Reef " Producer and film director John Ford once again demonstrates his talent for successful, wild romantic comedies with this action-packed John Wayne classic.   Life on a South Pacific island is almost perfect for two ex-Navy friends ( John Wayne and Lee Marvin ) - they spend most of their time arguing and fighting in the local saloon, Donovan's Reef. This somehow manages to ward off the monotony of tropical life. One day, Elizabeth Allen , a cool-headed beauty from Boston, bursts into the scene searching for her father.

metadata.Plot: In an ideal society on a picturesque South Sea island, people of several races and backgrounds live together in harmony. John Wayne is a WWII hero, who worked hard to own a shipping company and finds his true love. She is as strong a woman as he is a man. An adventure and love story.
metadata.Writer: Frank S. Nugent, James Edward Grant, Edmund Beloin
metadata.Actors: John Wayne, Lee Marvin, Elizabeth Allen
